laboratory_examinations.findings: MRI showed bilateral enhancing lesions in all cervical neural foramina, with cord compression at C1–2, C2–3, and C4–5.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: MRI of the left leg showed enlargement of the sciatic nerve, with subsequent MRI showing increased nerve thickening and cystic changes.

laboratory_examinations.findings: CT scan of the abdominal area showed multiple tumors involving the pelvic and paraspinal nerves and multiple subcutaneous masses.
MRI of the brain showed no abnormalities. An MRI of the cervical spine showed bilateral enhancing tumors at each level.
The results of routine laboratory tests were normal.
MRI showed presence of multiple mass lesions along the cervical spinal roots.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Weakness increased over a period of about a year and spread to include his right leg and arm.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Mutation analysis revealed a substitution of glutamine for arginine at residue 1276 in the NF1 gene.
